quote: You blithering idiot! … You festering gumboil! You fleabitten fungus! … You bursting blister! You moth-eaten maggot!
author: Roald Dahl

quote: You ride well, but you don't kiss nicely at all.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: He was a goddam stupid moron. He hated it when you called him a moron. All morons hate it when you call them a moron.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: Well, well, well, well. If it isn’t fat, stinking billygoat Billy-Boy in poison. How art thou, thy globby bottle of cheap, stinking chip-oil? Come and get one in the yarbles, if you have any yarbles, you eunuch jelly thou.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: If your brains were dynamite there wouldn’t be enough to blow your hat off.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: I do desire that we be better strangers.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: As for [Stanley] Baldwin, one could not even dignify him with the name of stuffed shirt. He was simply a hole in the air.
author: George Orwell

quote: Don’t fool yourself, my dear. You’re much worse than a bitch. You’re a saint. Which shows why saints are dangerous and undesirable.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: She's as nutty as squirrel poo.
author: JK Rowling
source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quote: A deistical prater, fit to sit in the chimney-corner of a pot-house, and make blasphemous comments on the one greasy newspaper fingered by beer-swilling tinkers.
author: George Eliot

quote: In my mind, Martha, you are buried in cement right up to your neck. No… right up to your nose… that’s much quieter.
author: Edward Albee

quote: I never saw anybody take so long to dress, and with such little result.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Thou woldest make me kisse thyn old breech, And swere it were a relyk of a saint, Though it were with thy fundement depeint!… I wolde I hadde thy coillons in myn hond… Lat kutte hem of.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: She’s not leaving me. Certainly not for a common swindler who’d have to steal the ring he put on her finger.
author: F Scott Fitzgerald

quote: I misjudged you … You’re not a moron. You’re only a case of arrested development.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: He would make a lovely corpse.
author: Charles Dickens
source: The Life And Adventures Of Martin Chuzzlewit

quote: You talk too damn much and too damn much of it is about you.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: He liked fishing and seemed to take pride in being able to like such a stupid occupation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The man is as useless as nipples on a breastplate.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: You bloody old towser-faced boot-faced totem-pole on a crap reservation.
author: Kingsley Amis

quote: Your little dog licks your mouth and lips, Manneia. I am not surprised – it always enjoyed eating shit.
author: Martial

quote: Villain, I have done thy mother!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Confusion is a luxury which only the very, very young can possibly afford and you are not that young anymore.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Zoilus, why do you pollute the bath by plunging your ass into it? A tip — Want to make it filthier? Do this: Submerge your head in the bath as well.
author: Martial

quote: She is a peacock in everything but beauty!
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I'll beat thee, but I would infect my hands.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Out of my sight! Thou dost infect mine eyes.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Let the doors be shut upon him, that he may play the fool no where but in's own house.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If the whole human race, ourselves excepted, were swept away, and we two stood alone on the earth, I would leave you in the old world, and betake myself to new.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Out, you tallow-face! You baggage!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Hubert Humphrey is a treacherous, gutless old ward-heeler who should be put in a goddamn bottle and sent out with the Japanese current.
author: Hunter S. Thompson
source: Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail

quote: Don't be a moronic lump of blubbering, quaking, pathetic lard.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: A more vain and absurd animal than you was certainly never allowed to cumber the earth. You had no right to be born; for you make no use of life.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: She looked, I decided this morning, much more like a horse than a human being. In fact she would have been a very nice horse with a little grooming.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: To speak much is one thing; to speak to the point another!
author: Sophocles

quote:
They don't hardly make 'em like him any more - but just to be on the
safe side, he should be castrated anyway.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: You speak an infinite deal of nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast.
author: Oscar Wilde
source: Only Dull People are Brilliant at Breakfast

quote: May your genitals sprout wings and fly away.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: A pox o’ your throat, you bawling, blasphemous, incharitable dog!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: She plunged into a sea of platitudes, and with the powerful breast stroke of a channel swimmer, made her confident way towards the white cliffs of the obvious.
author: Somerset Maugham

quote: Nothing in his life became him like the leaving it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Trinculo, if you trouble him any more in's tale, by this hand, I will supplant some of your teeth.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If you will forgive me for being personal ... I don't like your face.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: How dare you be so fraudulently flirtatious, cowardly and dysfunctional? I am not interested in emotional fuckwittage.
author: Helen Fielding

quote: He was one of the numerous and varied legion of dullards, of half-animated abortions, conceited, half-educated coxcombs.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: The simplicity of your character makes you exquisitely incomprehensible to me.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If I was as ignorant as you I wouldn't let on.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have.
author: J. K. Rowling
source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quote: He was a … vicious gossip, with a vocabulary composed almost entirely of obscenities, guttural verbs, and the word 'postmodernist'.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: I detest the masculine point of view. I am bored by his heroism, virtue, and honor. I think the best these men can do is not talk about themselves anymore.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: All God's children are not beautiful. Most of God's children are, in fact, barely presentable.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: He would make a good lamp post if he’d weather better and didn’t have to eat.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
author: Jane Austen

quote: You freakish homunculus, germinated outside of lawful procreation.
author: Henry Arthur Jones

quote: At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: A melancholy-looking man, he had the appearance of one who has searched for the leak in life's gas-pipe with a lighted candle.
author: P. G. Wodehouse
source: The Man Upstairs and Other Stories

quote: It was one of the dullest speeches I ever heard. The Agee woman told us for three quarters of an hour how she came to write her beastly book, when a simple apology was all that was required.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: You're one of those guys who can make a party just by leaving it. It's a great gift.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Why do you sit there looking like an envelope without any address on it?
author: Mark Twain

quote: He’s not human; he’s an empty space disguised as a human.
author: John Fowles

quote: You’re a beast and a swine and a bloody, bloody thief!
author: William Golding

quote: You deserve this. You have killed yourself. Yes, you may kiss me, and cry; and wring out my kisses and tears: they’ll blight you—they’ll damn you.
author: Emily Brontë

quote: He was a tool of the boss, without brains or backbone.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Some people are easier to love when you don’t have to be around them.
author: Irvine Welsh

quote: You’ve got about as much charm as a dead slug.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: If you’re looking for sympathy, you’ll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary.
author: David Sedaris

quote: 'I know you for a man of ambition,' Ser Courtnay broke in. 'A man who changes kings and gods the way I change my boots.'
author: George R. R. Martin

quote: 'It would seem that you have no useful skill or talent whatsoever,' he said. 'Have you thought of going into teaching?'
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: To describe the young haremaid's singing voice as akin to a frog trapped beneath a hot stone would have been a great insult to both frog and stone.
author: Brian Jacques

quote: You guys are so unhip it's a wonder your bums don't fall off.
author: Douglas Adams
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: I got to tell you, you don’t look too bright. I got a son, stupid as a man who bought his stupid at a two-for-one sale, and you remind me of him.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote:
'Going to dance at my wake?' 
'I don’t dance,' the lawyer answered, 'but you tempt me to learn.'
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Mothers are all slightly insane.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Your hair wants cutting.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: I couldn’t possibly have sex with someone with such a slender grasp on grammar!
author: Russell Brand

quote: If looks could kill, you’d soon find out that yours couldn’t.
author: Iris Owens

quote: If a giant thinker like Aristotle could err in his evaluation of slave-labour, why should a dwarf economist like Bastiat be right in his evaluation of wage-labour?
author: Karl Marx

quote: She’s got brains enough for two, which is the exact quantity the girl who marries you will need.
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote: A prig is a fellow who is always making you a present of his opinions.
author: George Eliot

quote: Come, my friend, and remember the rich have butlers and no friends, and we have friends and no butlers.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: The more money an American accumulates, the less interesting he becomes.
author: Gore Vidal
source: An Homage to Daniel Shays: Collected Essays

quote: You know who does have a funny bone in her body? Your mom every night for a dollar.
author: Tina Fey

quote: Did you expect me to rejoice in the inferiority of your circumstances?
author: Jane Austen

quote: Longbottom, if brains were gold, you'd be poorer than Weasley, and that's saying something.
author: J. K. Rowling
source: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quote: Ralon of Malven has beggars and thieves for ancestors. He's the son of a lizard and a demon. He has all the honor of a weasel.
author: Tamora Pierce

quote: Are you in great physical pain, or is that your thinking expression?
author: G.A. Aiken

quote: I would compare Kant in his self-mystification to a man who at a masked ball flirts the whole evening with a masked beauty under the illusion of making a conquest, until at the end she unmasks and reveals herself—as his wife.
author: Schopenhauer

quote: You're so full of crap, you could pass for a toilet.
author: Kami Garcia

quote: “I can only assume," said Jace, "that mortal emotions amuse you because you have none of your own.”
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: I swear, talking to you is like talking to a really good-looking and mildly stupid brick wall.
author: Derek Landy

quote: Roses are red, violets are blue, I have five fingers, the middle one is for you.
author: Gena Showalter

quote: Did anybody tell you that you're a few french fries short of a Happy Meal?
author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

quote: You," Madeline said, her voice hollow and wheezing, "are like a bad case of herpes, wizard. You're inconvenient, embarassing, no real threat, and you simply will not go away.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: He's a pig and I don't allow livestock in the house.
author: Erin McCarthy

quote: May the IRS find that you deduct your pet sheep as an entertainment expense.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: You blocks, you stones, you worse than senseless things!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The only process you've mastered is the process of elimination, and the only reason you've mastered that is because you can do it in the toilet.
author: Orson Scott Card
